Commentary.ab: Y11.4a us.mē ... frə̄rənaōt̰] Form with double praeverb unusual (Delbrück, 1893 p. 434 ff. us° + ar- is a hapax. Pirart, 2004 p. 111 n. 367 corrects in uši (unattested).
Y11.4a mat̰ hizuuō] Geldner, Kellens, Pirart mat̰.hizuuō. Bartholomae gen. instead of instr., but cf. Yt19.95 instr. sg. xᵛaēpaiθiia hizuuō. Maybe OAv. hizuuā, YAv. hizuuō (hizuua unattested).

Parallels.ab: ahurō mazdā̊ aṣ̌auua haŋᵛharəne mat̰ hizuuō hōiiumca dōiϑrəm = Y11.5.

And the yazad Hōm curses that person, he says: (~ Y11.4-7) "May you not have children, and may dishonour and other afflictions be yours, you who do not use me in worship. Nor do you consecrate the meal which (my) father Ohrmazd gave to me the jaw along with the tongue and left eye of all beneficent animals, and the varieties of beneficent animals you do not consecrate (for me), but you devour (it)! Whoever does not consecrate that food which my father Ohrmazd gave to me, but devours it, in his house will be born neither priest nor warrior nor husband man. In his house people of the line of sorcerers will be born, and will destroy the creations of Ohrmazd. (He is) the miscreator who ruins things, and (even if) he will undertake many duties and obligations, he will bring nothing at all to completion, and I shall bind him in the spiritual slate with those bonds with which I bound Frasyab the Tūr."
gōspand ka kušt ud pārag judāg kard ā-š gāušudāg ēdōn baxšišn huzwān ērwārag ud cašm ī hōy hōm yazad xwēš gardan.
"When a gōspand is slaughtered and divided into pieces, its gōšōdō should be distributed in this manner: the tongue, jaw and left eye (are) Hōm Yazad's own.
ka ēk did rāy ul yazēd *ā šāyēd bē uzwān ud ērwārag ud čašm ī hōy čē ān hōm yazd xwēš az ān gyāg paydāg hizuuąm frərənaōt̰ .

"(If) one offers up one (part) to another (yazad), it shall be proper, except for the tongue and jaw and left eye, for those (are) Hōm Yazad. (This is) manifest from that passage (containing the words) hizuuąm (and) frərənaōt̰."

con sar-e gusfand ḫᵛāhand yaštan sar tamām nahand yā aravāra yaʿni guš-e cap həzvą̇n yaʿni zabān va cašm-e cap va gušt az ān gusfand gušodā kardan va ḫešnuman-e darun in ast ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō x́arənaŋhatō aməṣ̌ną̇m spəṇtaną̇m haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō aoxtō.nāmanō ẏazatahe pa yazamaydi ahurəm mazdą̇m raēuuṇtəm x́arənaŋhuuṇtəm ẏaz• aməṣ̌āspəṇtā huxṣ̌aϑrā huδā̊ŋhō ẏaz• huməm zāirīm bərəzṇtəm ẏaz• huməm frāsmīm frādat̰.gaēϑəm ẏaz• huməm dūraošəm ẏaz• aṣ̌āuną̇m vaŋhuīš sūrā̊ spəṇtā̊ fruuaš́aiiō ẏaz• arvār pa guǧodā nemišāyad usmē paiti haomāi dronō frə̄ri.nōit̰. ahurōmazdā̊ aṣ̌auua haŋharəna mat̰.hizuuō hōiiumca dōiϑrəm ni pə̄dir həmēṣ̌a ą̇n ō hmə̄surxfrājit aormazd aṣ̌ō uruuār vā hizuuą̇n ą̇ni cap dōsr yʿani cašm.

"If one wishes to consecrate the head of a gusfand, the whole head should be put (for consecration), (if not), the arvār i.e., the left ear, the hizvān i.e., the tongue and the left eye (should be consecrated). The goshodā (to be placed with the Darun) should be (a piece of) flesh of that gusfand. The Khshnuman (for the consecration) of the Darun is ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō x́arənaŋhatō aməṣ̌ną̇m spəṇtaną̇m haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō aoxtō.nāmanō ẏazatahe pa yazamaydi ahurəm mazdą̇m raēuuṇtəm x́arənaŋhuuṇtəm ẏaz• aməṣ̌āspəṇtā huxṣ̌aϑrā huδā̊ŋhō ẏaz• huməm zāirīm bərəzṇtəm ẏaz• huməm frāsmīm frādat̰.gaēϑəm ẏaz• huməm dūraošəm ẏaz• aṣ̌āuną̇m vaŋhuīš sūrā̊ spəṇtā̊ fruuaš́aiiō ẏaz•. The arvār (i.e., the left ear, the tongue and the eye) should not be used as goshodā (as according to the following passage of Y11): usmē paiti haomāi dronō frə̄ri.nōit̰. ahurōmazdā̊ aṣ̌auua haŋharəna mat̰.hizuuō hōiiumca dōiϑrəm" (Dhabhar, 1932, pp. 262).
